Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
literally: breath or wind; hence: = action by which humans speak words with no substance or value
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
exact meaning unsure; literally: to make attachments with words about someone; hence, possibly: = action by which someone holds a speech against someone else

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= state in which humans help other humans to find the inner strength to face difficult circumstances; ≈ this can have both a positive (courage) and a negative (stubbornness) sense
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= causative action by which events reduce the intensity of a certain state or process
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which events reduce the intensity of a certain state or process
= state in which humans experience grief
= causative action by which humans desist from performing an event that has not yet started

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: to go away; hence: = process by which event stop happening
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose

Node.gloss: to seize|to snatch away|to cause to wrinkle|to cause to shrivel up|to cause to dry up
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities take hold of humans ► in order to harm them|= causative action by which deities cause the skin of humans to shrivel or dry up ◄ as a result of a bad health
= an event that functions as evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= state of having lost body volume
= action by which humans provide evidence in court
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

Node.gloss: to tear to pieces|to maul|to mangle
Node.definition: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness
= action by which humans or deities act with violent aggression towards (other) humans ◄ as if bearing a grudge against them

Node.gloss: to grind one's teeth|to gnash one's teeth
Node.definition: = to gnash or grind one's teeth עַל with regard to someone else ► in order to express one's hostility
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

Node.gloss: to give someone a menacing glare
Node.definition: literally: to sharpen (one's) eyes; hence: = action by which someone glares at someone in a menacing way

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
jaw, cheek
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
literally: to fill oneselves; hence: = action by which humans form a group in order to carry out a certain activity together
= causative action of controling and restricting movement; that is, to hand over a person or an object to another's control
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

Node.gloss: to thrust (someone) into the clutches (of someone else)
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure; literally, possibly: to cast (someone) forcibly on the hands (of someone else); hence: = causative process by which deities use force to deliver humans in the hands of others

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
literally: to go around; hence: = action by which groups of humans or animals take position all around an individual, a group, or an object
= soldier specialized in fighting with bow and arrow
literally: kidney; hence: = seat of a person's emotions and devotion to God, created by God, and hidden to everyone but God himself

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
= causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= contents of the gall bladder

Node.gloss: to break|to breach|to make breaches|to cut
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make one or more large holes in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

= large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

= large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= a coarse dark material ◄ made of goat or camel hair; ► worn next to the skin as a sign of mourning or repentance
= to join together pieces of cloth or animal skin with stitches using a needle and thread from local plants ... for making clothing or shelter
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a human being
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= outgrowth of bone encased in hardened skin, often curved and pointed, found in pairs on the heads of cattle, sheep, goats, and other animals; ≈ associated with strength and honor; a raised horn symbolizes confidence and/or pride
= state in which parts of one's body have a somewhat reddish color
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
literally: pure; hence: = state in which an event is considered without fault

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

Node.gloss: to act as a spokesman|to act as a mediator
Node.definition: to act as an intermediary for a party for communicating with another, physically or hierarchically remote, party
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which an object has a hole or crack in it, so that liquids or other objects can pass through

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which objects are relatively low in quantity, or in which events are relatively low in frequency
literally: to come; hence: = process by which things happen to someone ◄ as if it were a person coming to visit
= relatively narrow road (דֶּרֶךְ) that connects two locations and facilitates travelling
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
literally: to go; hence: = process by which living creatures live their life until the moment of death
